page.title: 06The Vicar of Whittlesey 2
page.content: The property that the church owns in the parish now is the two churches, two halls one for each church, a house that the curate lives in and vicarage. Compared with a hundred years ago the land owned by the church is fairly small because then the vicar was paid from the rent of the land locally owned, but now most of that land has either been sold, or is being managed by central government. I think people reading this in a hundred years will want to know that nowadays people go to church if they want to, in the olden days people went to church because they had to. Now it is getting back to the way Jesus said it was to be, where people were free to choose which path they wished to follow, they would only come to him if they wanted to. I think the church in Whittlesey will survive a long time.
